授業目的: International Marketing:The course challenges you to think critically about the role of marketing in the increasingly global economy. As such, rote learning of terms and concepts is not sufficient; you are prepared to take the senior marketing executive's seat in managing business on a global basis. senior marketing executive has the responsibility for designing, implementing, and guiding an organization's marketing efforts. Marketing executives are by definition generalists. They do not have to be expert practitioners in every aspect of marketing. However, they do need to have a solid understanding of each aspect.
到達目標: The fundamental premise underlying market-driven strategy is that the market and customers that form the market are the starting point in strategy formulation. Described as market-driven strategy, the key challenges for business organizations include:   1) developing a shared vision throughout the organization about the market and how it is likely to change in the future; 2) identifying opportunities for delivering superior value to customers; 3) positioning the organization and its brands in the market place to obtain the best match between distinctive capabilities and value opportunities; 4 ) recognizing the potential benefits of partnering with customers, suppliers, distribution channel members, internal functions, and even competitors; and 5) implementing and managing marketing strategy on a global basis.  At the end of the course, you will learn the changing nature of global competition and the importance of the simultaneous pursuit of economies of scale and cultural sensitivities in marketing operations.
関連科目: Marketing, International Business
授業方法: Face to face class format.The course is taught, using a combination of lectures, case analysis and class discussion. The textbook will give you a broad picture of what global marketing management is all about. To enhance your grasp and management of various problems global marketers face, you are required to work in a group on both Assignments (A) In-Class Presentation of the Assigned Case and (B) Case-Writing Group Project. Each group will be made up of a number of students and will work as a unit for all group assignments throughout the semester. A comprehensive exam is also scheduled as Assignment (C) to assess your understanding of the class material.
